Posts.Content: maiyre wrote: Hi , I've posted before about orange de peau appearance on my right breast. Since my symptoms appeared in September, I've had 2x mammograms, 2x ultrasounds, and MRI. I got a call today telling me the most recent MRI and targeted Ultrasound is suspicious and now need a MRI guided biopsy and BC surgeon consultation. My question is wouldn't all these tests be able to diagnose or rule out lymphedema or blocked lymph nodes or scar tissue? I ask bc of symptoms, I really thought it would be related to my bilateral axillary breast tissue removal surgery. Now I'm not sure. I'm not asking for diagnosis but insight from personal experience is greatly appreciated! Thanks, Maiyre Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosing truncal lymphedema maiyre LymphActivist

Posts.Content: maiyre wrote: My mri guided biopsy came back as stromal fibrosis and fibroadenomatoid changes. Does anyone know if this could cause inflammation , orange de peau and skin color changes? I'm waiting for a dr appt to discuss this with her. I'm just wondering if it isn't related, if I should pursue the skin biopsy to rule out IBC. I'm definitely relieved but still need answers. Thanks in advance for any help on this. Maiyre Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stromal fibrosis and fibroadenomatoid changes maiyre CUGymGirl
